intro: Goniolimon speciosum f. alpinum, commonly known as the alpine goniolimon, is a rare and specialized plant species adapted to high-altitude environments. It belongs to the family Plumbagaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, often blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine meadows and tundra regions. It is known for its ability to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
